general_advisory: In paddy crop, Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are critical. Cover the rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Apply sprinkler irrigation to bring down the heat effect. Ensure water does not remain stagnant in the field. Spread polythene in irrigation channels. High temperature in day hours may lead to wilting in tomato and brinjal. Mulch coconut leaves. Cover vegetable seedlings. Harvest fingerlings in shallow ponds. Yellow stem borer management in paddy. Blast disease management. Tobacco caterpillar management. Early shoot borer management in sugarcane. Brinjal shoot and fruit borer management. Whitefly infestation in okra. Harvested onion storage. Mango hopper control.

advisory: Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are critical. Avoid water deficit.
Cover the rows with dry leaves and top-dress with 4% potassium. Irrigate frequently during hot months.
High temperature increases water requirement. Avoid stagnant water in the field.
Apply 1g Streptocyclin in root zone to prevent wilting.
Install pheromone traps and spray neem-based pesticide during pest infestation.
Mulch coconut leaves around the tree to reduce water loss.
Cover newly planted seedlings with paper caps during the day.
Harvest fingerlings in shallow ponds if temperature rises.
Check migration of caterpillars and use appropriate insecticides for control.
Check migration of caterpillars and use appropriate insecticides for control.
After harvesting, store dried bulbs in a well-ventilated room.
Control mango hoppers with specific insecticide sprays.
Treat okra seeds to prevent whitefly infestation.
